title: Vernon Kay: ‘I didn’t have a penny but I felt like a king – and started a pension with £1’
text:
Bolton-born Vernon Kay, 45, is a television and radio presenter and former model. From 1998, he co-hosted T4, Channel 4’s youth strand, alongside June Sarpong, Dermot O’Leary and Margherita Taylor.

He went on to present 12 series of All Star Family Fortunes on ITV and has also fronted weekend shows on BBC Radio 1.

Kay is currently a Formula E motor racing presenter and columnist. He lives in Buckinghamshire with his wife, the television presenter Tess Daly, and their daughters, Amber, 15, and Phoebe, 10.

How did your parents influence your attitude to money?

I come from a stereotypical northern working-class family where if you didn’t go out and earn a living you had nothing to fall back on....
description: Bolton-born Vernon Kay, 45, is a television and radio presenter and former model.
